title: How do you lose LP in Ranked?
body:
So i have a smurf in Silver at the moment, but i want to drop it to Bronze 5 before i let my brother play on the account (because i don't think hes good enough to be in silver). So he can start from the bottom. He knows how to play already so he doesn't want to start a new account from level 1. So I'm wondering whats the quickest way i can drop the account to Bronze 5 without feeding super hard every game and getting reported/hurting my team mates LP? Because i would feel bad if i was dropping peoples LP or making them miss a promo just for this :( 

Any advice or strategies?

replies.body: Add me, i can help you.

Let your brother play from Silver, if he can take it it will remain in silver, if he cant he will drop down naturally to a level in which he can play comfortably without intentionally feeding. 
keeping him in silver would probably be better for improving his skills too.

i dont think there is another way to drop LP other than afk or intentional feeding, and doing either of those things in ranked on purpose is pretty low.

Account sharing is not allowed. GG

"im not sharing, i'm giving it to him"

Still not allowed
i never said sharing or giving :/
You said you wanted to drop it so you're brother can play on it... sounds like sharing to me.

You lose:

Lesser Lp - Lost in higher elo than your ranking average, E.G: Silver 5 (you) up against Silver 2 / 1's (Opponents), unless if you win you get more Lp

More Lp - Lost in low elo than your ranking average, E.G: Bronze 2 (you) up against bronze 4 / 5's (Opponents), unless if you win you get LP, but not as much as usual

Check your mmr (Match Making Rating)  and compare it to your rank (E.G: Master Yi's Students).
I go to oce.op.gg to check my mmr, it automatically compares it to your own rank average mmr.

Hope this helps ^

Feeding/doing really badly is the only way. If you queue dodge to lose LP, you can drop 0LP in your current division, then lose a couple to drop one tier/division, however when you queue dodge it doesn't lower your mmr so he could be bronze but still vsing ppl at the mmr you were before. And it's quite a slow way to drop because time penalties after queue dodging.
